This property verifies that the count signal correctly resets to zero under specific conditions. The assertion triggers on the positive edge of the clock signal clk_i and is disabled when the active-high reset signal rst_i is asserted.

When all three conditions are simultaneously true - rst_i is low (0), the changed signal is zero (0), and the count signal is less than 1 - then exactly one clock cycle later, the count signal must equal a value of all zeros with a width defined by CW.

The property ensures that when the system is not in reset (rst_i low) and both changed is inactive and count is below threshold, the count value properly clears to zero on the next clock cycle.
